meanings.definition: Proceeding or changing by small increments or degrees.
meanings.sent1: The sun's graduals rise in the morning brought a gentle warmth to the land.
meanings.sent2: The graduals decline in temperature signaled the arrival of autumn.
meanings.sent3: The snail's graduals pace in the race made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her graduals improvement in painting was like watching a flower bloom.
meanings.sent5: The graduals growth of the seedling was barely noticeable each day.

meanings.definition: A book containing the musical portions of the Mass for each day of the year.
meanings.sent1: The choir director opened the ancient graduals to prepare for the Sunday service.
meanings.sent2: The library had a collection of beautiful graduals for different liturgical seasons.
meanings.sent3: The cat knocked over the stack of graduals, creating a musical mess.
meanings.sent4: The graduals on the shelf seemed to whisper melodies of old hymns.
meanings.sent5: The priest carefully selected a graduals for the special Easter celebration.
